attributes.action: Stop the propsed ammendments to the bill of rights
attributes.additional_details: Uphold the  law and not commit harm to the people
attributes.background: Stop the Humen right of speech to be taken away and uphold the law

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about proposals to change legislation relating to human rights, but we're not sure exactly what changes you're concerned about.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

The Government has published a consultation on proposals to reform the Human Rights Act 1998, which you can read and respond to here: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/human-rights-act-reform-a-modern-bill-of-rights
